meanings.definition: A person who believes that human existence is irrational and meaningless.
meanings.sent1: The absurdist pondered the futility of life's purpose.
meanings.sent2: She found solace in the writings of famous absurdist philosophers.
meanings.sent3: The absurdist chuckled at the irony of searching for meaning in a chaotic world.
meanings.sent4: His view of life as a meaningless play was truly absurdist.
meanings.sent5: The absurdist's perspective on existence was both bleak and thought-provoking.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the philosophy of absurdism.
meanings.sent1: The play had an absurdist theme that left the audience questioning reality.
meanings.sent2: She appreciated the absurdist elements in the artist's paintings.
meanings.sent3: The absurdist humor in the movie made her laugh uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: His absurdist take on life painted a vivid picture of chaos and order.
meanings.sent5: The absurdist philosophy challenged traditional beliefs with its unconventional approach.

meanings.definition: Characterized by absurdity or the quality of being absurd.
meanings.sent1: The absurdist situation made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent2: His absurdist sense of fashion always turned heads at the party.
meanings.sent3: The absurdist twist in the story caught the audience by surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her absurdist choice of words added a touch of whimsy to the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The absurdist nature of the comedy show left the audience in stitches.
